channel.title: How would i make this type of command
channel.description: Ok, I was wondering how i would make a type of command like if i typed ::bandos the bandos armor would instantly pop up on my character. I can make all the easy commands but i was wondering if anyone knew how to make one like that? Tbh i've never seen any servers that had a type of command like that.

item.title: How would i make this type of command
item.dc:creator: @dd1 dd
item.description:
@dd1 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:16, topic:191480”][quote author=dd link=topic=255105.msg2125848#msg2125848 date=1206153914]
Why would you put NPCDialogueSend = true;
[/quote]
To get rid of any itnerfaces on the screen, it is declared in 90% of servers as opposed to sendQuest = false.[/quote]

Not in my server.

I guess theres nothing wrong with it then lmao.

Read full topic

item.title: How would i make this type of command
item.dc:creator: @zubmage zubmage
item.description:
@zubmage wrote:

Oh I see.

One second.

if (command.startsWith("bandos")) { playerEquipment[playerChest] = 15348; playerEquipment[playerLegs] = 15349; playerEquipment[playerFeet] = 15350; playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 15334;

I think thats it…

Edit: Nevermind, eczema3 beat me to it.

Your better off using his command because its more likely to work.

item.title: How would i make this type of command
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

you guys must not read half the post? i read it and 60% of the people who posted on here obviously didnt, because he said he wanted a command that automatically equips the items when he types the command, NOT just to add them to his inventory.

else if command.equalsIgnoreCase("bandos") { playerEquipment[playerChest] = ID; playerEquipment[playerLegs] = ID; playerEquipment[playerFeet] = ID; playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = ID; NPCDialogueSend = true; updateRequired = true; sendMessage("bandos RAWR");
should work, i cant see why it wouldnt

Read full topic

item.title: How would i make this type of command
item.dc:creator: @redrover redrover
item.description:
@redrover wrote:

actually its more like this

else if command.equalsIgnoreCase("bandos") {
additem( ITEMID,  AMOUNT); 
additem( ITEMID,  AMOUNT); 
additem( ITEMID,  AMOUNT); 
additem( ITEMID,  AMOUNT);

and ECT

also it depends on what client you use if you use silabs client just search Bandos id Change it with ITEMID and change amount to 1 and you’re done

Read full topic

item.title: How would i make this type of command
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

…that would be an “easy command”.

Come to think of it, I can’t really bring to mind any command functionality that would be difficult.

Just extend your beautiful command if-else statement one more time:

else if command.equalsIgnoreCase(“bandos”) {
addItem( args );
}

Read full topic
